register.description: IP Revision Identifier (X.Y.R) Used by software to track features, bugs, and compatibility

bitfield.description: Used to distinguish between old scheme and current.
Function value
RTL Version (R), maintained by IP design owner. [[br]]
Major Revision (X), maintained by IP specification owner. [[br]]
Custom version
Minor Revision (Y), maintained by IP specification owner. [[br]]
VPFE busy bit
This bit is latched by VD (start of frame)
Data write enable. [[br]]Controls whether or not input raw data is written to external memory. [[br]]This bit is latched by VD. [[br]]
VD/HD enable. [[br]]Activates internal timing generator to synchronize with external VD/HD signals. [[br]]This bit should be set to 1 when HD and VD signals are used at any time.
Field status. [[br]]Indicates the status of the current field when in interlaced mode.
[[br]]3-tap low-pass (anti-aliasing) filter. [[br]]This bit is latched by VD.
Setting data input mode
Pack to [[br]]8-bit/pixel (into external memory)
CCD data width is only valid when INPMOD is set to 0.
Sensor field mode
Input data polarity

External WEN selection. [[br]]When set to 1 and when VDHDEN is set to 1, the WEN signal is used as the external memory write enable (to external memory). [[br]]The data is stored to memory only when the external sync (HD and VD) signals are active.

bitenum.description: Do not use external WEN (write enable)

bitfield.description: Field indicator polarity
HD sync polarity
VD sync polarity
Field ID Direction
VD/HD Sync Direction
Width of HD sync pulse if output HDW+1 pixel clocks HDWIDTH is not used when HD is input, i.e when VDHDOUT in SYN_MODE register is cleared to '0' *This bit field is latched by VD
Width of VD sync pulse if output VDW+1 lines VDWIDTH is not used when VD is input, i.e when VDHDOUT in SYN_MODE register is cleared to '0' *This bit field is latched by VD

register.description: Number of pixels in a horizontal line and number of lines in a frame

bitfield.description: Pixels per line - number of pixel clock periods in one line HD period = PPLN+1 pixel clocks PPLN is not used when HD and VD are inputs, i.e when VDHDOUT in SYN_MODE register is cleared to '0' *This bit field is latched by VD

Half lines per field or frame - sets number of half lines per frame or field VD period = (HLPFR+1)/2 lines HLPFR is not used when HD and VD are inputs, i.e when VDHDOUT in SYN_MODE register is cleared to '0' This tells the internal timing generator to generate the sufficient number of HD pulses in between two VD pulses. [[br]]If the sensor is an interlaced sensor, say for example, with a total of 525 (or 526) lines, then this field should be set to 525 (or 526). [[br]]This means that 525 (or 526) half lines are written for each field. [[br]]If the sensor is progressive, then this register should be set to be twice the number of lines to be written. [[br]]For example, if sensor outputs 1024 lines, this field should be set to 2048. [[br]]Therefore, for interlaced sensors, this field should be set to the total number of lines. [[br]]For progressive sensors, this field should be set to twice the total number of lines. [[br]]*This bit field is latched by VD
Start pixel, horizontal. [[br]]The SPH sets the pixel clock position at which data output to external memory begins, measured from the start of HD. [[br]]This bit field is latched by VD.

Number of pixels, horizontal. [[br]]NPH sets the number of horizontal pixels that is output to external memory = (NPH + 1) and 0xFFF0 (i.e., the number of horizontal output pixels truncates to multiples of 16). [[br]]This bit field is latched by VD.

register.description: Vertical Line - Settings for the Starting Pixel Register

bitfield.description: Start line, vertical (field 0). [[br]]SLV0 sets line at which data output to external memory will begin, measured from the start of VD. [[br]]This bit field is latched by VD.

Start line, vertical (field 1). [[br]]SLV1 sets line at which data output to external memory will begin, measured from the start of VD. [[br]]For a progressive sensor this field is ignored. [[br]]This bit field is latched by VD.

Number of lines, vertical. [[br]]NLV sets the number of vertical lines that will be output to external memory. [[br]]The number of lines output to external memory = (NLV + 1). [[br]]This bit field is latched by VD.

register.description: Culling Information in Horizontal and Vertical Directions Register

bitfield.description: Horizontal Culling Pattern for Even Line, [[br]]8-bit mask. [[br]]LSB is first pixel, MSB is 8th pixel, then pattern repeats. [[br]]This bit field is latched by VD.

bitenum.description: Retain (to be saved to external memory)

bitfield.description: Horizontal Culling Pattern for Odd Line, [[br]]8-bit mask. [[br]]LSB is first pixel, MSB is 8th pixel, then pattern repeats. [[br]]This bit field is latched by VD.

bitenum.description: Retain (to be saved to external memory)

bitfield.description: Vertical Culling Pattern, [[br]]8-bit mask. [[br]]LSB is first line, MSB is 8th line, then pattern repeats. [[br]]This bit field is latched by VD.

bitenum.description: Retain (to be saved to external memory)

bitfield.description: Address offset for each line. [[br]]LNOFST Sets offset for each output line in external memory Either 16 or 32 pixels depending on setting of PACK8. [[br]]The 5 LSB are ignored, and a zero is returned when read[[br]] the offset will be on a [[br]]32-byte boundary. [[br]]For optimal performance in the system, the address offset should be on a [[br]]256-byte boundary. [[br]]This bit field is latched by VD.
Field identification signal inverse. [[br]]This field is latched by VD.
Line offset value of field ID = 1. [[br]]This field is latched by VD.
Line offset values of even line and even field ID = 0. [[br]]This field is latched by VD.
Line offset values of odd line and even field ID = 0. [[br]]This field is latched by VD.
Line offset values of even line and odd field ID = 1. [[br]]This field is latched by VD.
Line offset values of odd line and odd field ID = 1. [[br]]This field is latched by VD.

32-bit external memory starting address for VPFE output. [[br]]This bit field is latched by VD. [[br]]The address should be aligned on a 32-byte boundary. [[br]]Therefore, the 5 LSB's are ignored. [[br]]Furthermore, reading this register will always show the 5 LSB's as 0. [[br]]For optimal performance in the system, the address should be on a 256-byte boundary. [[br]]
Clamp enable. [[br]]Enable or disable clamping of CCD data based on the calculated average of optical black samples. [[br]]This bit is latched by VD.
Optical black sample length. [[br]]Number of Optical Black Sample pixels per line to include in the average calculation
Optical black sample lines. [[br]]Number of Optical Black Sample lines to include in the average calculation
Start pixel of optical black samples. [[br]]The start pixel position of optical black samples, specified from the start of HD in pixel clocks.

Gain to apply to the optical black average. [[br]]Multiply the optical black average with the specified gain. [[br]]1Fh = 1 + 15/16 1Eh = 1 + 14/16 ... [[br]]= ... [[br]]10h = 1 + 0/16 0Fh = 0 + 15/16 0Eh = 0 + 14/16 0Dh = 0 + 13/16 ... [[br]]= ... [[br]]02h = 0 + 2/16 01h = 0 + 1/16 00h = 0 + 0/16
DC level to subtract from CCD data. [[br]]The DC value set here is subtracted from the CCD data when OBS clamping is disabled - CLAMP.CLAMPEN.
Color Pattern for 3rd Line, Pixel counter = 3
Color Pattern for 3rd Line, Pixel counter = 2
Color Pattern for 3rd Line, Pixel counter = 1
Color Pattern for 3rd Line, Pixel counter = 0
Color Pattern for 2nd Line, Pixel counter = 3
Color Pattern for 2nd Line, Pixel counter = 2
Color Pattern for 2nd Line, Pixel counter = 1
Color Pattern for 2nd Line, Pixel counter = 0
Color Pattern for 1st Line, Pixel counter = 3
Color Pattern for 1st Line, Pixel counter = 2
Color Pattern for 1st Line, Pixel counter = 1
Color Pattern for 1st Line, Pixel counter = 0
Color Pattern for 0th Line, Pixel counter = 3
Color Pattern for 0th Line, Pixel counter = 2
Color Pattern for 0th Line, Pixel counter = 1
Color Pattern for 0th Line, Pixel counter = 0
Black level compensation for R/Ye pixels (-[[br]]128:+127). [[br]]2's complement, MSB is sign bit.
Black level compensation for Gr/Cy pixels (-[[br]]128:+127). [[br]]2's complement, MSB is sign bit.
Black level compensation for Gb/G pixels (-[[br]]128:+127). [[br]]2's complement, MSB is sign bit.
Black level compensation for B/Mg pixels (-[[br]]128:+127). [[br]]2's complement, MSB is sign bit.

CCDC_VD0_INT interrupt timing. [[br]]Specify VDINT0 in units of horizontal lines from the start of VD pulse. [[br]]Resulting value is VDINT0+1. [[br]]Note that if the rising edge (or falling edge if programmed) of the HD lines up with the rising edge (or falling edge if programmed) of VD, the 1st HD is not counted. [[br]]

CCDC_VD1_INT interrupt timing. [[br]]Specify VDINT1 in units of horizontal lines from the start of VD pulse. [[br]]Resulting value is VDINT1+1. [[br]]Note that if the rising edge (or falling edge if programmed) of the HD lines up with the rising edge (or falling edge if programmed) of VD, the 1st HD is not counted. [[br]]
Apply Gamma (A-LAW) to VPFE data saved to external memory
A-law Width Input (A-LAW table)
FVH error correction enable
REC656 interface enable

Enable latching function registers on internal VSYNC. [[br]]If this bit is set, all the register fields that are VSYNC latched will take on new value immediately. [[br]]Care should be taken not to alter fields that can cause undesired behavior to the output data. [[br]]
MSB of Chroma signal output inverted
MSB of Chroma input signal stored to SDRAM inverted
Byte Swap Data stored to SDRAM
Location of Y signal when YCbCr 8bit data is input
Specifies CCD valid area

bitenum.description: Internal valid signal and WEN signal is Ored logically
Internal valid signal and WEN signal is ANDed logically

bitfield.description: The data width in CCIR656 input mode
Y input (YIN[[br]][7:0]) and C input (CIN[[br]][7:0]) are swapped
Y output (YOUT[[br]][7:0]) and C output (COUT[[br]][7:0]) are swapped
DMA Overflow Flag Flag bit that is set when data is dropped due to a delay in writing data out the DMA interface. [[br]]This bit remains set until a 1 is written by software. [[br]]

Sets the priority that all command should be sent with on the DMA bus. [[br]]This register should only be modified when the Module is inactive or it could cause violations of the CBA specifications. [[br]]A value of 0 is the highest priority while a value of 0x7 would be the lowest priority
Configuration of the local initiator state management mode. [[br]]By definition, initiator may generate read/write transaction as long as it is out of STANDBY state

bitenum.description: Smart-Standby wakeup-capable mode: local initiator standby status depends on local conditions, i.e. the module's functional requirement from the initiator. IP module may generate (master-related) wakeup events when in standby state. Mode is only relevant if the appropriate IP module "mwakeup" output is implemented

Smart-standby mode: local initiator standby status depends on local conditions, i.e. the module's functional requirement from the initiator. IP module shall not generate (initiator-related) wakeup events
No-standby mode: local initiator is unconditionally placed out of standby state. Backup mode, for debug only.
Force-standby mode: local initiator is unconditionally placed in standby state. Backup mode, for debug only.

bitfield.description: Configuration of the local target state management mode. [[br]]By definition, target can handle read/write transaction as long as it is out of IDLE state

bitenum.description: Smart-idle wakeup-capable mode: local target's idle state eventually follows (acknowledges) the system's idle requests, depending on the IP module's internal requirements. IP module may generate (IRQ- or DMA-request-related) wakeup events when in idle state. Mode is only relevant if the appropriate IP module "swakeup" output(s) is (are) implemented.

Smart-idle mode: local target's idle state eventually follows (acknowledges) the system's idle requests, depending on the IP module's internal requirements. IP module shall not generate (IRQ- or DMA-request-related) wakeup events.
No-idle mode: local target never enters idle state. Backup mode, for debug only.
Force-idle mode: local target's idle state follows (acknowledges) the system's idle requests unconditionally, i.e. regardless of the IP module's internal requirements. Backup mode, for debug only.

bitfield.description: VPFE Master OCP interface Status

bitenum.description: OCP Master Interface is in Standby mode

bitfield.description: VPFE Master OCP interface enable. [[br]]Software can has to use this bit to enable/disable the VPFE master OCP interface. [[br]]When the master OCP interface is disabled, it is placed in Standby mode. [[br]]Standby mode can also be entered by using the right setting on the STANDBYMODE field in the SYSCONFIG register
Pixel clock inversion enable

bitenum.description: The pixel (CCDC) clock input to the VPFE is inverted before it is used internally in the module

bitfield.description: CCDC VD2 interrupt status raw value - A read value of 1 from this register indicates that the VD2 interrupt status is 1. [[br]]- When the read value is 0 , software can write the value to 1 to set the interrupt - Writing a 0 to this bit has no effect. [[br]]

CCDC VD1 interrupt status raw value - A read value of 1 from this register indicates that the VD1 interrupt status is 1. [[br]]- When the read value is 0 , software can write the value to 1 to set the interrupt - Writing a 0 to this bit has no effect

CCDC VD0 interrupt status raw value - A read value of 1 from this register indicates that the VD0 interrupt status is 1. [[br]]- When the read value is 0 , software can write the value to 1 to set the interrupt - Writing a 0 to this bit has no effect. [[br]]

CCDC VD2 interrupt status value - A read value of 1 from this register indicates that the VD2 interrupt status is 1., if it is enabled - When the read value is 1 , software can write a 1 to clear the interrupt. [[br]]- Writing a 0 to this bit has no effect. [[br]]

CCDC VD1 interrupt status value - A read value of 1 from this register indicates that the VD2 interrupt status is 1., if it is enabled - When the read value is 1 , software can write a 1 to clear the interrupt. [[br]]- Writing a 0 to this bit has no effect

CCDC VD0 interrupt status value - A read value of 1 from this register indicates that the VD2 interrupt status is 1., if it is enabled - When the read value is 1 , software can write a 1 to clear the interrupt. [[br]]- Writing a 0 to this bit has no effect
CCDC VD2 interrupt enable - Write 1 to enable this interrupt - Write 0 has no effect - Read 1 indicates interrupt is enabled - Read 0 indicates interrupt is not enabled. [[br]]
CCDC VD1 interrupt enable - Write 1 to enable this interrupt - Write 0 has no effect - Read 1 indicates interrupt is enabled - Read 0 indicates interrupt is not enabled
CCDC VD0 interrupt enable - Write 1 to enable this interrupt - Write 0 has no effect - Read 1 indicates interrupt is enabled - Read 0 indicates interrupt is not enabled
CCDC VD2 interrupt disable - Write 1 to disable this interrupt - Write 0 has no effect - Read 1 indicates interrupt is enabled - Read 0 indicates interrupt is not enabled
CCDC VD1 interrupt disable - Write 1 to disable this interrupt - Write 0 has no effect - Read 1 indicates interrupt is enabled - Read 0 indicates interrupt is not enabled
CCDC VD0 interrupt disable - Write 1 to disable this interrupt - Write 0 has no effect - Read 1 indicates interrupt is enabled - Read 0 indicates interrupt is not enabled
